Boston.com

Back Bay fire, blackout

City struggles to return to normal amid power outages

Meat from The Capital Grille on Boylston Street was loaded onto a truck to prevent spoilage from the power outage affecting parts of the Back Bay. Joanne Strohmeyer/ Globe Staff
At Sugar Heaven on Boylston Street, Kayleigh Dunn relied on window light to work on the schedule. Joanne Strohmeyer/ Globe Staff
NStar provided a map of Boston showing which areas are still affected by the power outages. NStar
Nstar crews worked across from the Boston Public Library, which has been without power since last night. Joanne Strohmeyer/ Globe Staff
Flames from the Back Bay fire could be seen in this photo taken from Dalton Street with Kings bowling alley in the foreground. Yoon S. Byun/ Globe Staff
Smoke was visible rising above the Boston skyline in this photo taken from the Squantum section of Quincy. Stan Grossfeld / Globe Staff
After the blaze was first reported, firefighters worked to gain entry to the garage next to the Back Bay Hilton. Alexandre Isobel for The Boston Globe
Another photo showing smoke from the Back Bay fire was taken near Abe and Louie's restaurant on Boylston Street. Cliff Atiyeh / Globe Staff
People stood along Boylston Street, parts of which were without power overnight. Yoon S. Byun / Globe Staff
The Back Bay skyline was filled with smoke from the fire as seen in this photo taken on Newbury Street. Taylor Aldredge / tayloraldredge.com

  • NStar crews go underground to restore power
  • Video Capital Grille attempts to save meat
  • Pictures Back Bay fire causes major blackout

  • Green Line closures | Quinn: People civil during blackout
  • Live blog Community reports on the outages

Catherine Greig set to plead guilty

James "Whitey" Bulger's girlfriend, Catherine Greig, is expected to plead guilty today to charges she helped him evade capture for 16 years. (Globe, 12:35 p.m.)

GOP fight now Romney vs. Santorum

Rick Santorum is nipping aggressively at Mitt Romney's heels after frustrating the front-runner in the South and giving Newt Gingrich little to show. (AP, 12:50 p.m.)

Growing income gap threatens area

The disparity between Boston's top earners and its poorest workers has widened and could continue to grow, according to the nonprofit Boston Foundation. (Globe)

Opinion | Brian McGrory

We will pay for this
warm weather

When an entire winter is blissfully wiped off the ledger, we’re going to have hell to pay — guaranteed. This is New England and things never break in our favor.

Bus crash in Switzerland kills 28

A tour bus slammed into a tunnel wall in the Swiss Alps in a horrific accident that killed 22 school children and six adults returning to Belgium from a ski vacation.

Travel

Boston's Irish Heritage Trail

Explore more than 300 years of Irish-American history in Boston by following the Irish Heritage Trail. The tour consists of 20 stops along 3 miles, featuring many important historical events in the lives of those of Irish descent in the city and its surrounding area.
